article_text:
Iowa Sen. Chuck Grassley Chuck GrassleyDefense bill renews fight over military sexual assault Reid knocks GOP over 'light' Senate schedule Overnight Tech: Facebook finds no bias but vows to change trending feature MORE (R) celebrated Constitution Day and his 81st birthday early Wednesday morning with a 6.2 mile run.

Grassley tweeted a post-workout picture of him standing outside the steps of the Senate.

U.S. Capitol after this am 6.21 mi run. Happy Constitution Day pic.twitter.com/LcB62FkdSs — ChuckGrassley (@ChuckGrassley) September 17, 2014

In another tweet, Grassley explained that he likes to run from “Home to the Dome” once a year, but otherwise runs three miles each day. During a 2010 question-and-answer, he said he starts running at 5:15 a.m. to get his workout in before work.

I celebrated my birthday w 6.21 mile-run I call the "Home to the Dome" run I do once yr otherwise just run 3miles a day — ChuckGrassley (@ChuckGrassley) September 17, 2014

Grassley received praise for his fitness on Twitter.

So @ChuckGrassley is 81 and he's more in shape than I am I think. — Ethan Klapper (@ethanklapper) September 17, 2014
